item.title: Understanding Why Replication Is Not a Substitute for Backup
item.description: In today’s data-centric landscape, safeguarding information is paramount. While replication and backup are both integral to data protection strategies, they serve distinct purposes and are not interchangeable. This article delves into the differences between replication and backup, emphasizing why replication should not be considered a substitute for backup solutions.

item.title: The 3-2-1 Backup Rule: A Proven Strategy for Data Protection
item.description: Data loss can happen in many ways—whether due to accidental deletion, cyberattacks, hardware failure, or even a catastrophic event like a data center fire. To protect against these risks, IT professionals have long relied on the 3-2-1 backup rule, a fundamental strategy for ensuring data resilience.
